body.name: TOSHIBA 6-in-1 Inverter Microwave Oven Air Fryer Combo, MASTER Series Countertop Microwave, Air Fryer, Broil, Convection, Speedy Combi, Even Defrost, Sound On/Off 27 Auto Menu Stainless Steel
features: 【6-In-1 Ultimate Versatility】TOSHIBA MASTER 6 in 1 Inverter Microwave with 10 power levels can be your ultimate kitchen helper. The versatility as a microwave, air fryer, convection oven, broiler, defroster, Speedy-Combi, make it your best countertop space-saver

【Inverter Technology for Even Cooking & Defrost】TOSHIBA ORIGIN Inverter Technology allows more uniform distribution of heat in cavity, provides even cooking, reheating and defrosting, guarantee the maximum tender texture. Also the 50dB working noise level brings you and your family a quiet and undisturbed cooking environment.

【Less Fat and Crispier】TOSHIBA convection microwave with 360° heat circulation air fry cuts down on calories by using no added oil while delivering crispier and golden fried food like chicken nuggets, fried fish and French fries. The supplied bake tray and two wire racks are used for optimal air fry results. NOTE: Please use convection mode if need to customize timing and temperature, functions equally as air fryer.

【Speed up Cooking with Combi-Modes】Despite powerful output of 1800W under Convection up to 425°F and 1000W under Grill, Combi-Modes speed up your cooking with combination of Microwave, convection and grill function, while delivering perfect dishes with crispy, browned outsides and tender texture insides.

【Discover Amazing Recipes】Comes with an original cookbook with 27 classic recipes. Also, the microwave itself has 11 Auto Menus, 10 Air Fry Menus and 6 Defrost Presets, so that novice can also make Michelin-star meals at home. External Dimension: 19.5”W x 17.6”D x 11.5”H with 11.3” turntable.

How to customize timing and temperature for air fry function? Press Convection button, set prefered timing and temperature and press the switching knob to start the process, convection functions equally as air fry. Why does the microwave fan keep running after all the cooking process shuts down? The microwave has a cooling system to prevent the machine from overheated and insure long-term durability, the fan may keep runnnig for up to 3 minutes after cooking is completed depending on the cooking time and modes How to stop/resume/cancel an in-process cooking program? To pause, press once the red Stop/Cancel button to the right of the switch knob. To resume, press the main control switch knob and the cooking command continues. To cancel, press the Stop/Cancel button twice, the unit will be back at reset status. Why does my glass turntable drag while operating/doesn't fit the turntable ring? It's normal that the turntable drags a bit depending on food size and what spot was the food placed, rest assured that it doesn't affect daily use. If the turntable is making unusual noise or you would like a replacement, please reach out to us. Why does the product look different from those in reviews? We have upgraded the design of a few buttons on the panel to make it easier to understand and operate, rest assured that all functions and basic interaction are still the same.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like this microwave because it has different functions and it’s super convenient. It comes with the tools for oven and a recipe. I like how quiet it is when it’s heating up food, unlike other microwaves that are noisy when they are heating up food. The food gets hot and the plate is warm after they’re heated, unlike other microwaves which they cause the plate to be super hot and dangerous to grab. It feels really safe. This microwave is high quality as well and I love it so much. I would definitely recommend it to my friends and family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars good quality！loves it！
reviews.reviewText: I already used it more than one month! It works very great!The color is very advanced. That's a lot of capacity. It can be used as a microwave or an air fryer. Save money! And a roasting pan and a rack to roast meat on! Heat up fast too! Easy to operate! My son can heat his own milk too! I use it all the time to make roast chicken wings! That's great! Oil-free. Very healthy! Loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like it
reviews.reviewText: We have had this microwave about 2 months now, after my not-even-a-year-old GE crashed and died, and they wouldn't warranty it. I like this one (it was recommended on CNET, which is how I found it). It's a little more complicated, yes, but it doesn't take long to figure out the basics. I saw someone review it and start by saying something like "I haven't read the manual and I don't intend to." I don't recommend that approach. You should read the manual where the settings are discussed (or at least the quick reference guide). It isn't intuitive, but in exchange you get a fairly clean interface and a compact unit that doesn't swallow the whole countertop. I love, love the defrost function-- it's hands-down the best I've seen in a microwave. The rest are ok. I can do chicken wings on convection, bread on broil, and reheat all sorts of things. I think some of the settings are not necessary, so I just keep the quick guide nearby and use it as a guide (ie I don't notice any difference when I airfry chicken nuggets or french fries on the same setting, except for time, and I check that anyway, so I just pop it on the first one I come to). I love the convect and airfry/micro combinations. They give me crisp food that is also cooked inside. I will use this pretty much exclusively in the summer because I hate firing up my oven when it's hot. A couple of notes:--the unit is not as strong a micro as package times indicate, so you may need to go longer than the cook times on items like frozen veggies. It's nbd (maybe +1 minute), but something to keep in mind.--it doesn't have a sensor (I missed that when I ordered it), so "reheat" is just time-based (you need to check the food).--it doesn't get super hot like my old one did around it. That said, I keep it on a heat-proof mat to protect my countertops.--the top heating element is in the back, so food in the middle of the plate (rather than the sides) doesn't get as brown in the oven/broil/airfryer. It must be moved around a bit.If you want something you can just fire up and not think about, I would get a different model (just not the GE, because I'm not the only person that sucker died on for over $400😡). However, I like how small this is, how nice it looks, and it does a great job for like 95% of what I need. It's also a lot less expensive and, supposedly, will last longer (I'll definitely update if it doesn't). I'm happy with it so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Save the space. Get an All-in-One
reviews.reviewText: So far I’ve been impressed with both functions and ease of use. The first thing I used it for was defrosting 2 chicken leg quarters. No hot spots like other microwaves I’ve used.This morning I made hash browns and then cracked some eggs over the top. It was easy using the convection feature to get crispy hash and the eggs in two additional minutes. No big greasy mess.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars For those who like air fryers and defrosting
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this microwave in late November 2022, and am maintaining my original, 3-star review below. This update is from April of 2023. I do not recommend this microwave at all. I have lower usage than average, since I am alone, and air fryer and convection functions I used up till last week now no longer work. For example, I had used the preset air fryer setting for chicken legs, and they were crisp and well-cooked in the past, yet trying the exact same function this week left me with chicken that was raw inside. I successfully cooked meats with convection, much as timing was 'hit or miss,' and the same meat I managed to cook a week ago came out raw inside. My reporting the problem to the vendor led to my being told to be sure food was defrosted and that I used proper cooking times. My last microwave was working well after 17 years - this one failed in a matter of months!I wish I could have replaced the microwave, with grill and roast functions, that I already had, but it was 17 years old, and I feared it might 'die,' so I got this model with a special Cyber deal. I just ruined a steak in it!With my other microwave, I could choose 'grill' or 'roast,' press a number for the type of meat, put in the weight, choose 'rare,' and have the cooking time automatically calculated. This is totally hit and miss. Instructions, and the cookbook, do not list times for broiling or cooking, and the presets are only for air frying and defrosting. Even the air frying presets listed are very limited. I attempted to prepare meat using an air fryer recipe, and it did not work. (I gather that one use 'convection,' enter a temperature and time, and hope for the best.) The 'combi' mode was supposed to give me tender meat, but there is no indication of cooking time for whatever type of meal one is preparing. Pressing 'broil' leads to presets - but the instructions do not say what these presets mean. All times have to be entered manually. The only function I could have used, entering the weight, was defrost - not cooking!I've been using Toshiba products since the 1970s, and thought of them as quality. The inadequate instructions, need to enter cooking times manually (without a clue as to how long it takes), presets that only seem to be for defrosting, and only automatic 'microwave' choices (such as beverage or potato), makes me wonder just how I'm going to prepare meat dishes - and the description on the Amazon page had given me the impression that the 'combi' cooking and 'inverter' would make the meats better than ever.I nearly gave it a '2' rating, but allowed three stars because, with the Prime Deal discount, one could not beat the price.
